pageContext.claim: “Certain plants don't have any problem at all. You know, you have plants with no problem at all. Then you have some where it was a hot spot. Those people are tending to get better very quickly.”
pageContext.analysis: A Guardian analysis found that almost half the covid-19 hotspots in the USA at the time were linked to meat processing plants where poultry, pigs and cattle are slaughtered and packaged. Trump has no basis to claim people in plants who get sick tend to "get better very quickly." At least 30 meat plant workers had died of covid-19 complications, and more than 10,000 have been infected or exposed, according to the United Food and Commercial Workers International Union. Almost 300 food-safety inspectors, who have struggled to get access to adequate protective gear, were sick with covid-19 or under self-quarantine due to exposure.
